item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There are two ways to dislike poetry: One is to dislike it; the other is to read Pope." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "By the way, a gendarme assured me this is not a prison." -- E. E. Cummings

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Muhammad Ali
item.description: "It's just a job. Grass grows, birds fly, waves pound the sand. I beat people up." -- Muhammad Ali

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Wolfgang Borchert
item.description: "Then she saw him stop and wipe his brow with his handkerchief. Once, twice. And then once again. But she did not see the grin of relief spread over his face. That she did not see because her eyes had filled with tears. And the geraniums, they were just as sad. In any case, that's how they smelled." -- Wolfgang Borchert

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Bacchylides
item.description: "Not unseated, Not even touched By the shocks of sickness, Gods stand worlds from men." -- Bacchylides

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "We're always thinking of eternity as an idea that cannot be understood, something immense. But why must it be? What if, instead of all this, you suddenly find just a little room there, something like a village bath-house, grimy, and spiders in every corner, and that's all eternity is. Sometimes, you know, I can't help feeling that that's what it is." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "I would not come in. I meant not even if asked, And I hadn't been." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "I wrote at the start that this was a record of hate, and walking there beside Henry towards the evening glass of beer, I found the one prayer that seemed to serve the winter mood: O God, You've done enough, You've robbed me of enough, I'm too tired and old to learn to love, leave me alone forever." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Boris Slutsky
item.description: "The horses suddenly began to neigh, protesting Against those who were drowning them in the ocean. The horses sank to the bottom, neighing, neighing. Until they had all gone down. That is all. Nevertheless, I pity them, Those bay horses, that never saw land again." -- Boris Slutsky
